issue.title: no detection after weight convertion

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Hello~
I'm facing the problem of weight conversion
Before the conversion, detect.py works fine and BBox was good.
But, there is no detection(BBox) after using the weight conversion in readme (.pt to .weight)
Does anyone know about it????

body: @TheophileBlard I'm thinking that perhaps we should plot P, R and mAP at seperate `--conf-thres`. mAP would naturally be computed near zero (i.e. 0.001), but P and R would perhaps be reported at 0.5 `--conf-thres`. This would be similar to Google AutoML reported results. https://cloud.google.com/vision/automl/docs/beginners-guide?authuser=1#how_do_i_interpret_the_precision-recall_curves ## 0.1 confidence ## 0.5 confidence ## 0.9 confidence
@glenn-jocher Sounds great! Current P&R curves are quite misleading, as the 0.001 threshold is defined in the code.

@TheophileBlard all done in feea9c1a65c73475803847c83545b5e7ee6c528c. Thanks for raising the issue, I think this update will help everyone! Here is a before and after run of the cooc64img.data tutorial. Let me know if you see any other problems.
![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26833433/76150500-f95cf580-605f-11ea-8884-46dace36b109.png)

issue.title: Interpreting Test Metrics

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
I'm training using my own dataset using train.py and otherwise default options, and want to make sure that I'm interpreting the results correctly ... it looks to me as if the reported precision and recall metrics are hard-coded to use an object confidence threshold of 0.1, is that correct?  In particular, I'm looking at line 180 of utils/utils.py in ap_per_class():

```
    # Create Precision-Recall curve and compute AP for each class
    pr_score = 0.1  # score to evaluate P and R https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/898
```
Assuming that's right, what is the purpose of the --conf-thres argument in test.py?

Also, at what IoU threshold are precision and recall computed?  I'm guessing 0.5 since that's the reported mAP level, but I'm not seeing where that's happening in the code.

Thanks in advance,
Tim

issue.title: How to boost recall in custom Dataset?

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Hello, I'm using the yolov3-spp to train my dataset with this command:
```
python train.py 
--data=./MyDataset/Mydataset.data
--batch-size=16
--weights=./weights/yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt 
--cfg=yolov3-spp1cls.cfg
--cache --epochs=300 --multi-scale
```
this is the plot:
![results_ultralytics](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49610198/80373719-11b2f900-88c8-11ea-91b5-7e4fbe3374ee.png)

and you can see that the recall is low.
Could you give me some suggestions about how to boost the recall, 
And my total loss(without cls loss) is about 2.0, is it normal?

body:
I may misunderstand the PR and RECALL at training stage. The plot below is what I got when training (using my custom data that has two classes: stop sign and yield sign, and I used the default setting to split data into train/val). You can see PR, RECALL and mAP are super bad (I used the default conf). 

![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23003826/80922652-696fbb00-8d33-11ea-9baf-9d0a1677c8fc.png)

However, when I run the test code for all the data together, as below: 
`python3 test.py --data data/stopsigns.data --cfg cfg/yolov3-spp-stopsigns.cfg \
--weights weights/yolov3-spp-ultralytics-stopsigns.pt`
I got results: 

               Class    Images   Targets         P         R   mAP@0.5        F1: 100%|
                 all       554       543     0.979     0.947     0.991     0.963
            stopsign       554       276      0.97     0.938      0.99     0.954
           yieldsign       554       267     0.988     0.955     0.992     0.971

Does it mean the model overfits the dataset a lot? But when I used the model to predict some random street pictures downloaded from internet, the performance seems okay.

@rightly0716 testing on your training data is only useful us a sanity check. It serves no purpose in terms of checking for generalization, which is what the test set is for. You P and R don't matter, as you select these yourself.

mAP is the metric that matters. If your training results are not to your liking, then its time for you to experiment on ways to improve them.

I see. I have only ~500 labelled data, and am wondering whether that can be a reason. Will do more deep analysis and see. 

Thanks!
@rightly0716 definitely more data would help. Also make sure you are training at an appropriate image size, and check your train*.jpg and test*.jpg images for correct labeling.

issue.title: low precision and recall with customized dataset, but high with --resume

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Firstly, thanks for your work.

When i training yolov3 with my customized dataset from scratch after 10 epoches, each epoch the precision and recall are very low, for example 0.127 and 0.004 (even after 20 epoches with 10w pics)

But when i stopped the training , and started another trainging with 'resume  True' to train from checkpoint, after one epoch, the precision and recall could be very high, 0.91 or higher.

Now, I always stop the training after one whole epoch, and than use "--resume " to training from the checkpoint to avoid the problem.

Is this a bug or something else?

issue.title: about the precision and recall curve

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
after the training,I got a picture of the result.But why the precison and the recall curve are positive correlation，when epoch increase,both the precision and recall are increasing.
![results2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61073631/82177097-2b65c000-990b-11ea-9def-1f7dba719b5d.png)

body:
I canceled the code commented by ap_per_class in utils as follows:
` # Plot
            fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(5, 5))
            ax.plot(recall, precision)
            ax.set_xlabel('Recall')
            ax.set_ylabel('Precision')
            ax.set_xlim(0, 1.01)
            ax.set_ylim(0, 1.01)
            fig.tight_layout()
            fig.savefig('PR_curve.png', dpi=300)`
There are two classes of my data set, but there is only one class in the PR curve graph. How can I solve it?
![PR_curve](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53636618/82275522-94a20d80-99b5-11ea-89e2-6ec5d2162bdf.png)

@tinothy22 ah yes, I see what you mean. The graph is inside the `for` loop, so it will plot one graph per class and save it (overwriting the previous one). If you want to overlay all of your classes you must modify the plotting code a bit, to create the figure before the loop, plot as is, and then save the figure after the loop.
thank you ,I try to change the code
